com.ticketmanor.model.recording

Class Duration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ticketmanor.model.recording.Duration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    @Embeddable
public class Duration
extends Object
implements Serializable
    This class describes a duration of time. It contains the hour, minutes and seconds. 
        Usage Example:

      Duration lunchDuration = new Duration(1, 0, 0); // 1 hr, 0 mins, 0 secs
      System.out.println(lunchDuration);

      Duration breakDuration = new Duration(0, 15, 30); // 0 hrs, 15 mins, 30 secs
      System.out.println(breakDuration);

      Duration labDuration = new Duration(2700); // 2700 seconds = 45 minutes
      System.out.println(labDuration);
    Author:
    570 Development Team
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Creates a Duration object with given parameter values

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Duration add(Duration aDuration)
      Returns a new duration object that is the sum of the supplied Duration object and current object
      int getHours()
      Returns the hours portion of the duration
      int getMinutes()
      Returns the minutes portion of the duration
      int getSeconds()
      Returns the seconds portion of the duration.
      int getTotalSeconds()
      Returns the total seconds
      void setTotalSeconds(int totalSeconds)
      This is needed because the Duration is stored as an Embedded field inside the Track, containing the total seconds
      Duration subtract(Duration aDuration)
      Returns a new duration object that is the difference of the supplied Duration and current object.
      String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Duration object: Format hh:mm:ss

        public int getMinutes()

      • getSeconds

        public int getSeconds()
        Returns the seconds portion of the duration. Note: This is NOT the total seconds.
        See Also:
        getTotalSeconds()

      • getTotalSeconds

        public int getTotalSeconds()
        Returns the total seconds

      • setTotalSeconds

        public void setTotalSeconds(int totalSeconds)
        This is needed because the Duration is stored as an Embedded field inside the Track, containing the total seconds
        Parameters:
        seconds -

      • add

        public Duration add(Duration aDuration)
        Returns a new duration object that is the sum of the supplied Duration object and current object

      • subtract

        public Duration subtract(Duration aDuration)
        Returns a new duration object that is the difference of the supplied Duration and current object. The difference returned is the absolute difference, so the duration will always be positive.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the Duration object: Format hh:mm:ss
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
